LFW AW14: David Koma show report

04/03/2014

Image by

By undefined undefined

[flickr-slideshow tags="davidkoma" caption="Photo credit: Lucy Wegerif"] Sleek, sharp and sophisticated; the David Koma show was all these things and more. Short dresses with leather cut-out panels, skater skirts and tailored trousers with polo necked jumpers; this was a collection that showed off everything that is glamorously sexy about a woman. Starting off with magenta, Koma then stuck to a muted but wearable palette of black, grey, blue and white. The jackets had a military vibe to them, single-breasted and falling to the floor, they skimmed the knee-high calf skin boots. Various dresses had a cage-like effect on the bodice, providing a fiercer side to the feminine figure hugging skirt. Make-up was kept minimal but fresh, with the hair as sleek and strong as the clothes. The Koma woman has always been sexy but for AW14 she has an edge, a darker side. Boys, you'd better watch out.
